intro: Physoclada, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy, blue to purple blooms. The plant has a bushy growth habit and is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and long-lasting flowers. Physoclada thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. It is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
